satelliteInfo: Our website is dedicated to the processing and analysis of satellite data.
subtitleB4G: Smarter care for parks, trees, and water bodies, powered by satellites.
paragraph1B4G: Blue4Green blends Earth Observation with your local data to monitor heat, water quality, shade, irrigation needs, and vegetation health.
paragraph2B4G: Our simple dashboard and alerts help city teams act sooner, meet EU Nature Restoration Law goals, and show real impact.
heatAnalysis: Heat Analysis: Citywide maps of land-surface temperature with modelled air temperature, heat-stress risk, UV guidance, and historical trends to track progress and target cooling actions.
waterQuality: Water Quality: Satellite-driven indicators for chlorophyll-a, blue-green algal bloom risk, turbidity, Secchi disk depth, and surface temperature, delivered as status, trends, and alerts for lakes and slow rivers.
shadeMapping: Shade Mapping: Time-of-day and seasonal shade coverage across parks, streets, and buildings to guide planting, canopies, and comfort routes.
treeIntelligence: Tree Intelligence: Individual tree detection where imagery supports it; canopy cover mapping from satellites city-wide.
irrigation: Irrigation: Zone-level recommendations (≈3 m pixels) that combine vegetation stress via evapotranspiration, weather, and local context to keep green assets healthy.
resilience: Resilience: Vegetation vitality and drought-pressure indices to flag at-risk areas and monitor recovery.
euNatureLaw: EU Nature Restoration Law: Consistent change detection, green-area accounting, biodiversity management, and exportable indicators to support reporting and compliance.
dataViewerText1: Access, download, and visualize our open and subscription Earth Observation services and data. Get started by contacting our support team, registering your account, and placing your order.
dataViewerText3: Use following direct demo login without prior registration to explore portal.
coolStreets: Cool the Hottest Streets: We detect heat hotspots and estimate near-surface air temperature to reveal where people face the greatest exposure. Results guide shade trees, cool materials, and misting stations, then track progress year over year.
saferLake: Safer Summers by the Lake: We deliver water quality metrics trends for lakes, reservoirs, and slow rivers. Early warnings help you communicate risks, protect public health, and optimize maintenance and aeration.
irrigateMatters: Irrigate What Matters: At ~3 m resolution, we prioritize zones that need water. You get a simple schedule and a map, so crews irrigate efficiently and timely.
shadeNeeded: Shade Where People Need It: We quantify shade coverage by time of day and season using 3D surface models. Plan trees and structures where comfort gains are highest, especially along pedestrian routes and play areas.
treeCanopy: Tree Canopy & Vitality: Citywide canopy and health indicators help plan pruning and replanting, with optional per-tree analytics from satellite imagery. Monitor storm impacts and recovery with consistent metrics.
riverCorridor: River Corridor Stewardship: Track riparian vegetation condition and water quality to target restoration. Combine EO with local surveys for reporting that’s credible and repeatable.
playfields: Playfields in Top Shape: Use stress indices and irrigation timing to maintain safe, resilient turf. Reduce closures and uneven wear with evidence-based scheduling.
euCompliance: EU Nature Restoration Compliance: Automate green-area quantification, change detection, and biodiversity proxies that support NRL requirements. Export ready-to-attach maps and data.
droughtReadiness: Drought Readiness: Spot vegetation trending toward stress before it turns brown. Direct mulch, irrigation, and species replacement budget where it will prevent losses.
equityCooling: Equity-Focused Cooling: Combine exposure with demographic layers to design fair cooling strategies. Track whether investments reduce risk in priority neighborhoods.
greeningDevelopments: Greening New Developments: Verify post-construction outcomes: canopy targets, shade at peak hours, and green-area net gains, using transparent EO evidence.
